meanings.definition: The state or quality of being expected.
meanings.sent1: The expectedness of the surprise party made it hard to keep a secret.
meanings.sent2: The expectedness of the sunrise brought a sense of comfort to the early risers.
meanings.sent3: The expectedness of the magician's tricks made the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The expectedness of the storm clouds looming overhead was a warning of the impending rain.
meanings.sent5: The expectedness of the school bell ringing signaled the end of the class.

meanings.definition: The likelihood of something happening or being true.
meanings.sent1: The expectedness of winning the lottery is very low.
meanings.sent2: The expectedness of a snowstorm in July is highly unlikely.
meanings.sent3: The expectedness of a penguin flying made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The expectedness of finding a needle in a haystack is comparable to this situation.
meanings.sent5: The expectedness of a fish climbing a tree is as absurd as this scenario.
